thread.section_title: Archive News & Video for Sunday, 28 Jan 2018 | Reuters.com
thread.title: Russian police force way into opposition leader Navalny's office - opposition TV

author: Reuters Editorial
title: Russian police force way into opposition leader Navalny's office - opposition TV
text:
MOSCOW, Jan 28 (Reuters) - Russian police forced their way into the Moscow office of opposition leader Alexei Navalny on Sunday and started questioning people, images broadcast online by Navalnyâ€™s supporters showed.
Roman Rubanov, a Navalny supporter, wrote on social media that the police said they were looking into reports that there was a bomb in the office, something he said came as a surprise to him.
Hundreds of supporters of Navalny began a nationwide day of protests against the authorities on Sunday, calling on voters to boycott what they said was a rigged presidential election on March 18. (Reporting by Andrew Osborn and Denis Pinchuk; Editing by Katya Golubkova)
